intro: Diospyros revoluta, commonly known as the rough-shelled ebony, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its small, dark purple to black berries. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a rough texture, contributing to its common name. The fruit is edible when ripe but is generally not cultivated for commercial use.
